meanings.definition: Make a quick, nervous movement of the face or body as an instinctive reaction to surprise, fear, or pain.
meanings.sent1: She flinches when the loud thunder startles her.
meanings.sent2: He always flinches when someone suddenly jumps out at him.
meanings.sent3: The cat flinches comically when it sees a cucumber behind it.
meanings.sent4: The soldier flinches at the sound of gunfire, his instincts kicking in.
meanings.sent5: The child flinches at the sight of a spider, his eyes wide with fear.

meanings.definition: Withdraw or recoil from something unpleasant or dangerous.
meanings.sent1: The dog flinches away from the vacuum cleaner's loud noise.
meanings.sent2: She flinches from the idea of going into the dark basement alone.
meanings.sent3: He flinches from eating broccoli, making a face at the mere thought.
meanings.sent4: The rabbit flinches from the approaching predator, seeking safety in its burrow.
meanings.sent5: The student flinches from the difficult math problem, feeling overwhelmed.
